entry.title: Withdrawal from Russia-led security treaty still on the table, says Armenian prime minister

media:group.media:title: Withdrawal from Russia-led security treaty still on the table, says Armenian prime minister
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia‚Äôs possible withdrawal from the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a Russian-led military alliance, is still on Armenia‚Äôs agenda, said Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan during a press conference today. üìçGayane Hakobyan, the mother of the fallen soldier from the 2020 war, stands accused of kidnapping the son of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and will be held in detention for one month.

entry.title: Development bank financing for Amulsar to hinge on environmental assessment: Business Week Armenia

media:group.media:title: Development bank financing for Amulsar to hinge on environmental assessment: Business Week Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs edition of CivilNet‚Äôs business digest:
üìçThe Eurasian Development Bank said it will decide to move forward with financing Armenia‚Äôs Amulsar mine only after an environmental impact assessment is completed. üìçThe French drinks giant Pernod Ricard, which owns the Yerevan Brandy Factory, said it will cease distribution of its products in Russia, the biggest market for Armenian brandy. üìçThe International Monetary Fund forecast Armenia‚Äôs economy to grow by 5.5% this year, noting ‚Äúshort-term benefits‚Äù from the war in Ukraine while warning of ‚Äúlonger-term risks.‚Äù üìçArmenia‚Äôs year-on-year inflation rate fell sharply last month to 3.2% ‚Äî below the Central Bank‚Äôs 4% inflation target for this year.
Credits: Ruptly
